page.title: 09Pembrey Memorial Hall
page.content: The Pembrey War Memorial Hall and Institute was opened in 1933. From 1919-1933 various events were held to raise money-Â£1,700 was contribued towards the total cost of Â£5,000. The remainder was provided by the Miners' Welfare Fund. The Memorial Hall from 1933_1969 became the cultural,leisure and entertainment centre of the Pembrey area. It was commandeered by the army during the 1939-1945 war. On January 1st, 1970 the building and surrounding 3 acres of land were given by deed of gift to the Camarthenshire Education Committee. Today, 1985, it is called the Community Centre and is again the centre for leisure activities in Pembrey. Adult classes, Youth Club, Gardening Club, Young Farmers, Guides,Brownies,Over 60's, Libraries, are some of the classes held there.
